column1: Female patient, 55 years old, with a remote history of LES positive for steroid therapy and obesity. Pathological history positive for contact with positive Covid-19 patient (husband).
Positive buffer. Patient in home trustee isolation for about 10 days; asymptomatic.
He arrives in pulmonary stenosis for the onset of dyspnea, fever and cough.
PO2 of 50%; High PCR; Procalcitonin and normal laboratory tests.
Chest computed/computerized tomography scan is performed without intravenous administration of contrast medium.
Axial images, reconstruction with Lung algorithm, apical, average and basal scan.

Multiple parenchymal thickenings of the pseudonodular type with density ground glass at the upper lobes, with a predominantly peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution, with associated areas of parenchymal thickening with a bronchogram of air that is patent in the context, at the LID and LIS.

Coronal reconstruction, reconstruction with Lung algorithm. Multiple areas of increased frosted glass lung density and associated areas of parenchymal thickening, with a prevalent peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution, with sub-total commitment of the lower lobes. SNG.
